# Question

Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
function timezone_bumper(dt::DateTime, bump::Int = 3)
    if isdate(dt)
        throw(ArgumentError("Cannot increase date by a timezone offset: $(bump) hours"))
    elseif isnan(dt.time) || dt.time == (16#FFFF_FFFF) # NaN or max timestamp value, should be caught here
        return dt
    end
    localtime = LocalTime(dt.time + Dates.hour(bump))  # Adjust for timezone offset
    return DateTime(localtime.hour, localtime.minute, localtime.second, localtime.millisecond; resolution=Millisecond)
end
```
